page.title: 19FLORA - PONDS & STREAMS
page.content: The banks of the streams are not good for flowers as they are periodically cleaned out by the River Board and mostly only annuals such as thistles and willowherb can survive this treatment. The many ponds in this area are often overhung with trees and too dark for much plant life or where there is an open pond the edges are often trodden by grazing cows. Sedges and reeds are common on poor ground. In marshy areas there are fine clumps of kingcups and yellow flags and hemlock water dropwort in almost every ditch.
